sections.content: Macronutrients—carbs, proteins, and fats—are nutrients your body needs in large amounts for energy, growth, and function. Understanding each type helps you make better food choices, optimize energy levels, and reach health goals. Quality matters more than quantity. This lesson breaks down each macronutrient and how to use them.

sections.title: Carbohydrates Explained
items: Function: Primary energy source, especially for brain and muscles
Simple carbs: Quick energy, spikes blood sugar (white bread, candy, soda)
Complex carbs: Sustained energy, stable blood sugar (whole grains, vegetables, legumes)
Fiber: Type of carb that aids digestion, keeps you full
Timing: Best before/after workouts for energy and recovery
Recommendation: 45-65% of daily calories from quality carbs
Choose: Whole grains, fruits, vegetables, legumes
Limit: Refined sugars, white bread, pastries

sections.title: Protein Essentials
items: Function: Builds and repairs muscles, tissues, enzymes, hormones
Amino acids: Building blocks of protein (9 essential from food)
Complete proteins: Contain all 9 essential (meat, fish, eggs, dairy, quinoa)
Incomplete: Missing some essential (most plant proteins)
Combine plant proteins: Rice + beans = complete
Amount: 0.8-1g per kg body weight (more if active/building muscle)
Distribute: 20-30g per meal better than all at once
Sources: Lean meats, fish, eggs, dairy, legumes, nuts, tofu

sections.title: Healthy Fats Guide
items: Function: Hormone production, brain health, nutrient absorption, satiety
Monounsaturated: Heart-healthy (olive oil, avocados, nuts)
Polyunsaturated: Omega-3 and omega-6 (fatty fish, flaxseeds, walnuts)
Saturated: Moderate amounts okay (coconut oil, butter, meat)
Trans fats: AVOID (partially hydrogenated oils, fried foods)
Omega-3s: Anti-inflammatory, brain health (salmon, sardines, chia)
Amount: 20-35% of daily calories from healthy fats
Quality matters: Choose whole food sources over processed oils

sections.content: The macronutrient ratio depends on your goals: Weight loss (higher protein/moderate carbs), Muscle gain (higher protein/carbs), Endurance (higher carbs), General health (balanced). No single ratio works for everyone. Start balanced (40% carbs, 30% protein, 30% fat), adjust based on how you feel and your results.

sections.title: Balancing Your Plate
items: ½ plate: Vegetables (non-starchy like broccoli, leafy greens)
¼ plate: Protein (palm-sized portion of meat/fish/plant protein)
¼ plate: Complex carbs (fist-sized portion of grains/starchy vegetables)
Fat: Thumb-sized portion (avocado, nuts, cooking oil)
Fruit: 1-2 servings daily
Adjust portions: Based on activity level and goals
Visual cues: Hand portions make tracking simple
Flexibility: Perfect balance every meal not required

quiz.question: What are complete proteins?
options: Proteins containing all 9 essential amino acids
quiz.explanation: Complete proteins contain all 9 essential amino acids your body can't produce. Found in meat, fish, eggs, dairy, quinoa. Plant proteins can be combined to create complete proteins.

quiz.question: Which type of fat should you avoid?
options: Trans fats from partially hydrogenated oils
quiz.explanation: Trans fats (partially hydrogenated oils) increase bad cholesterol and should be avoided. Healthy fats like monounsaturated, polyunsaturated, and moderate saturated fats are essential for health.
